result.execSummary:
The defendant Jamal A Hastings was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: 14CF1437

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

File State and Federal income taxes.  No contact with anyone under the age of 18 without approval of agent.  Comply with all Child Support and/or Family Court orders.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent, including cognitive behavior therapy. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

Court Reporter:  Jennifer Schmaling. Defendant Jamal A Hastings in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Jamal A Hastings in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing on 14CF1437, 15CF977, 15CF1231.

State indicated Chapter 950 compliance, no corrections to PSI.
Defense indicated PSI corrections from previous hearing.  

State recommends on 1437 - 4 years WPS (2+2); on 977 - WPS, stands silent as to length, but concurrent; on 1231 count 3 - WPS, stands silent as to length, concurrent, on count 4, jail, stands silent as to length, concurrent.
Defense requests on 1437 - 4 years WPS (2 + 2); on 1231count 3 - WPS 2 years (1+1) concurrent, on count 4, 6 months RCJ concurrent; on 977 - 4 years WPS (2+2) concurrent

BTC: on1437 count 1 - WPS 4 years (2 years IC & 2 years ES)
No alcohol or c/s unless prescribed by a physician, random UA's & breathalyzers
AODA assmt, treatment & aftercare, and any other counseling deemed appropriate by agent
full time employment
file state and federal income taxes
cognative behavior therapy
no contact with anyone over the age of 18 without approval of agent
comply with child support and family court orders

on 1231 count 3 (BJ):  WPS 2 years (1 year IC & 1 year ES)
same conditions, consecutive to 1431 count 1
count 4:  6 months RCJ - concurrent to 1437

on 977 - WPS 4 years (2 years IC & 2 years ES)
same conditions, concurrent to 1437

NOT eligible for CIP, but eligible for SAT
DNA sample on felony charges
firearms/voting warnings 
Costs including DNA on all 3 felony charges
CFTS - may bring back to court if disagrees with amount calculated

on 1231 count 4 (misdemeanor):  Costs including DNA assmt.
Sentencing hearing on January 27, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Jamal A Hastings in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Jamal A Hastings in custody.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense indicates that they got all but one of the CI tapes. Defense notified the State 12/23/15. Ms. Tanck-Adams was on vacation so Ms. Brave copied the DVD and put it in the 'file run'. Defense motions the Court to dismiss the cases. BTC: request denied.
Defense motions the Court to modify bond to $5000.00 on each if the three files. There are two people in court that are willing to co-sign a bond. Proposed co-signer, Ella Mae McMore 8-10-1974, Georgina Stone, 8/11/95. The State indicates that there is a pending referral for Ms. Stone for maintaining a drug trafficking place. 

BTC: Bond modification is denied in 14CF1437. In 15CF977 to $10,000.00 and 15CF1231 to $5000.00 cash - same terms and conditions.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 17, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 24, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
